Review.Titre: Temporary satisfaction and fulfillment of promises...
Review.Contenu: The idea of quick, accurate, and painless redemption of participants willingness to provide their time, energy, and honest feedback is honorable. My experience started off with promising momentum. As I continue to participate in taking timely surveys I am experiencing increased efforts to stall or "review" my answers rather than maintaining consist redemption of rewards. After my first redemption I am getting a lot of messages that read along the lines of "We are reviewing your answers. This is perfectly normal". I have no way to gage my progress toward redemption all while my answers/valuable data have already benefited the 3rd party. This all happened AFTER my first redemption. Stalling and reviewing to me seems more of a way to maintain collection of data without paying out the promised rewards. In turn, thus equals to the exact same hassle of every other "legit" survey site exhibits. It would be most impressive if the reviewing of data would stop.There is nothing to review...if there were indiscretions in my answers then the survey should've (like most) kicked me out or disqualified me. If a survey is completed then the immediate award should reflect. I have provided valuable data as a show of good faith that the company will honor them rather than pulling stunts that only conform this company to be like every other that offers false pretense and empty promises.

Review.Titre: Took a long time to accumulate
Spent over an hour or two surveys and was never paid
Review.Contenu: This site is normally a good site when you need to get quick money fast because they pay out immediately which is good. Early this morning this morning I did two surveys the first survey was on electronics and I wasn't provided with the survey number because after I was not qualified for one survey it automatically directed me to that survey it was supposed to take 40 minutes so I don't know what the pay was but I figured 40 minutes while it probably pays about $2 the survey had some kind of glitches where the server was slow and it took a while to get to the next question after it would get to the next question it would do it again some questions went through smoothly at the end of the surveying it said could not be connected to server I waited I refreshed and I sent it on again and it says your answers have already been sent but I was never compensated for that survey which took an hour the next survey I did with on alcoholic beverages it was supposed to take 14 minutes 10 to 12 minutes into the survey it booted me out and said that I did not qualify for the survey thing that's not the first time it happened but it's the last time that it would happen for me I would like to be compensated for those two surveys and from now on I believe that this site should let you know at least 1/4 of the way into the survey whether or not you qualify don't get all of my answers and then right before the survey is to end in Pay tell me that I don't qualify like I said I am generally happy with this site but not today. Later on today I went back to the site to try to complete some more surveys as times are hard these days I just spent 10 minutes completing a 10-minute survey that got to the point where it ask me what my race was to verify my income for my family they only paid $0.60 I guess what happened after I completed the survey it said this survey is not a good thing I don't know what is wrong with this website but they are getting people's opinions for free paying them either cents on the dollar a Pang of nothing at all which is been my experience with the last three so I thought maybe the first two times was just a glitch but now I know they are basically stealing from people

Review.Titre: Earn Haus. Just don't.
Review.Contenu: The surveys are good ones and the reward is higher, however they do not pay every survey instantly. I had 18 surveys in a 'hold' til they were reviewed by someone, then they conveniently just disappeared. Reported this yet they still have not responded. Now they want to charge 1$ for a payout of 5$, so you only receive 4$. I don't know what else to say except-'enter at your own risk!         *edit. I finally got a response from Earn Haus. You can see it below. I emailed them twice for this problem. And what is up with charging people a dollar to cash out 5$. You get rejected so many times. Guess they took my review to heart because now I have 23 surveys 'under review'. Kicker here!!!! My first surveys were fine. They do have good surveys. It will take you 2 months to get a good payout. So to add, I did start in October. I have been paid twice. First time it took me 3 days to receive my 5$ payout. The 2nd time, I cashed out 5.19$ then was told that I would be charged 1$. Do you have any idea what 1$ means?? I'm sure that you don't. 1$ can be the equivalent of 3 surveys because you have to do all the surveys that are 22 cents, 50 cents, 35 cents. That's up to 3 surveys I did and you wanna take that away from me. BTW I cashed out the first time in October then cashed out the day of my review. 16 days apart.

The only reason I gave it four stars is because I was turned down for some surveys that I spent maybe 30 or more minutes on just to be turned down with no payment for effort.  I know this is typical with many sites so I expected it.  Overall this is good site where you can give feedback on products you shop for everyday butit’s easy to lose interest if the surveys are long and boring.

Review.Contenu: This is the only survey site I have ever encountered where I didn't have to jump through any hoops or get bamboozled with false payouts or lies. I have cashed out at least 4 times already and within 10mins of hitting the redeem button. No support tickets, no rip offs. Kudos to Earn Haus for that! On the other hand, the surveys take too long for an extremely low yield sometimes. Researchers should not be allowed to deny payment if you complete the survey and they don't like the answers. This doesn't happen often because I read the details before I start now and I just don't do surveys that don't credit immediately anymore. Problem solved. Also $0.17 for 19mins is ridiculous. Other than that.. Earn Haus is legit. If they increase the pay for these surveys, they would put all the other "survey" sites out of business.

I suggest that maybe people not put in, in real time financial information because it can change at any time and just put in what they are accustomed to making. Otherwise, you don’t seem to get the credits. Also, the “under review process” takes forever.

Review.Titre: Fastest Payment but High % Flagged then Not Paid
Review.Contenu: Pay r̳e̳c̳e̳i̳v̳e̳d̳ within 15 minutes after only $5 earned which by far is the fastest I've seen.Of my first 96 surveys taken, over 38% were pended for review by the sponsoring client. Of the 37 pended for review, 2 were paid a day later but those 2 were the first paid after a review and after 93 surveys. Per EarnHaus support, industry standard is to reconcile by the end of the following month, but again, none of my reviewed surveys were paid later for April or May. 14 are still pending review but odds are not in my favor that they'll pay. When contacted, support at EarnHaus paid on 5 where extended time was committed only to find quotas full 𝙖𝙛𝙩𝙚𝙧 the survey was completed instead of at the beginning.Very regularly the time expectation is grossly underestimated by the sponsor. I am using a tablet to speed up clicking that a mouse would be slower for. I had one survey that was expected to pay $0.65 for 15-18 min. The 100+ questions took me over 30min and resulted in a review (which so far means very low chance of payment) For fun, I tried a 3min survey for $0.10 and it took over 20min and went to review (which again most likely means no payment.) Each survey has an option to provide feedback or concerns, but none of mine were responded to when using that option. However, support when directly contact has been super fast and cordial and very thorough.If the percentage of surveys that pend for review drops significantly or if more of the reviewed surveys pay later, I'll definitely update this review...

Review.Titre: They make several survey opportunities…
Review.Contenu: They make several survey opportunities for you to take. On each survey choice they tell you how long the survey will take and tell you how much you will be rewarded. There's no guessing how much you'll make or how long your survey will last. If for some reason you're not able to take the survey you've chosen then you have plenty more to choose from. I think the money they offer on each survey is fair and when you decide to withdraw you don't have to wait long at all. I received my money on my PayPal account really quick. They also notify me often about new surveys. It's been a great experience for me so far. I've made some extra money just here and there in my spare time and it adds up quicker than you might think. I would recommend Earn Haus to people that want to make some extra spending money in their spare time.
